title: Calculate the amount of Vowels in a String

c++: Take an array of characters and return a sum of all the vowels in any given string.
`calcVowels("The lazy dog jumped over the quick brown fox", 44)` ➞ `12`
`calcVowels("Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s", 151)` ➞ `37`
javascript: Take an array of characters and return a sum of all the vowels in any given string.
`calcVowels("The lazy dog jumped over the quick brown fox")` ➞ `12`
`calcVowels("Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s")` ➞ `37`

c++: Create a `int` returning function called `calcVowels` that takes in `(const char *_str, const size_t _size)`.
Iterate through each character, and check if they are a vowel.
Ensure that capital-cased characters are lower-cased.
Ensure that you are returning the sum as an `int`
*: Create a function called `calcVowels` that takes in `(_str, _size)`.
Iterate through each character, and check if they are a vowel.
Ensure that capital-cased characters are lower-cased.
Ensure that you are returning the sum as an `int`

javascript: calcVowels("The lazy dog jumped over the quick brown fox") == 12
calcVowels("Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s") == 37
calcVowels("Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old.") == 48
